item.title: Automation Driver Update
item.description:
Building a Simple Git + Make Installer GUI in Python

So I got tired of manually pulling from git, running make, and then installing the thing with sudo make install every single time I needed to update a driver or rebuild some source code. I wanted something cleaner — a one-stop GUI to handle the whole process with a few button clicks.

This is where my little project comes in: Git Make Installer — a simple Python-based GUI tool that does just that.

item.title: Return Oriented Programming
item.description:
Return-Oriented Programming (ROP) – A Beginner’s Journey

So recently, I finally took the dive into Return-Oriented Programming (ROP) and wanted to document my experience. Not just for anyone else learning, but also for future me when I inevitably forget how I did this in a week.

This post is based on a simple binary exploitation flow, and I followed along with the John Hammond Misfortune CTF ROP video. Highly recommend checking that out if you’re just getting into this.
